name: Discourse Forum - Login, Topic Browse, and Search Flow
description: Verify user login, topic browsing with category filtering, search functionality, and read-only topic viewing
steps: Navigate to https://try.discourse.org
Click the 'Log In' button in the top navigation bar
Enter username 'inbaperson' in the username input field
Enter password 'K7#mP9$vL2@xQ8!' in the password input field
Click the 'Log in' button to authenticate
Verify successful login by checking for user profile icon or username in the header
Verify the topic list table is displayed with class 'topic-list'
Verify multiple topic entries are visible with topic titles and metadata
Click on a category filter link with class 'category-link' for 'General' category
Verify the page displays filtered topics with the URL pattern '/c/general/*'
Verify the category badge is displayed showing 'General'
Verify the filtered topic list contains only topics from the 'General' category
Click on the search icon button with class 'search-icon' in the top navigation
In the search input field with id 'search-term', enter the search query 'welcome'
Press Enter or click the search button to execute the search
Verify the search results page loads with URL '/search?q=welcome'
Verify at least one search result is displayed in the results container with class 'fps-result'
Click on the first search result topic link
Verify the topic page loads with the topic title displayed in element with class 'fancy-title'
Verify the first post content is visible in the element with class 'cooked'
Verify the post metadata displays author name, timestamp, and reply count
Click the user menu icon in the top right with class 'icon-user'
In the dropdown menu with class 'user-menu', click 'Preferences'
Verify the user preferences page loads with URL pattern '/u/*/preferences'
Verify the preferences sections are displayed (Account, Profile, Notifications, etc.)
Click the user menu icon again and click 'Logout' button
Verify successful logout by checking the 'Sign Up' and 'Log In' buttons are visible in the header
